question: Hi,  I am a 46 yr old diabetic (insulin dependant).  I've had diabetes for 6 years, hbp, high cholesterol, you name it, if it's not supposed to be high, mine is.  I am significantly obese (350#).  I have 3 healthy daughters, and am pre-menopausal.  Last week, I went to the ER with lower abdominal pain which turned out to be a dermoid cyst.  It is large, and must be removed by open surgery.Has anyone had an open surgery (like hysterectomy) with their diabetes?  Any advice?  Any recovery information?I had a c-section 7 years ago, that had to heal from the inside out due to excessive bleeding.  It took over 6 months for the wound to heal, and I am desperately afraid that I may be facing a similar recovery.Please let me know if anyone has similar story?ThanksMorrowville
title: Diabetic about to have hysterectomy/open surgery
